Allow collection of additional data that helps Zoom make product improvements and provide enhanced information to help Zoom detect, diagnose, and remediate issues.
If the admin locks this setting, users will not be able to change the encryption type for meetings (i.e. scheduled, instant, PMI).
Start meetings with host video on
Start meetings with participant video on. Participants can change this when joining or in the meeting.
Determine how participants can join the audio portion of the meeting.

all_settings.setting: Allow participants to join before host
all_settings.description: Allow participants to join before the host arrives. If participants are not allowed to join before the host, or the host has another meeting running, participants will see a dialog that notifies them that the meeting has not started. This dialog can be customized through the Customize Waiting Room setting.

all_settings.setting: Participants can join [time] before start time
all_settings.description: A sub-setting to specify how early participants can join before the meeting starts.
A Personal Meeting ID (PMI) is a 9 to 11 digit number that is assigned to your account. You can visit Personal Meeting Room to change your personal meeting settings.

all_settings.setting: Use Personal Meeting ID (PMI) when scheduling a meeting
all_settings.description: You can visit Personal Meeting Room to change your Personal Meeting settings.

all_settings.setting: Use Personal Meeting ID (PMI) when starting an instant meeting
all_settings.description: Use your Personal Meeting ID for instant meetings.

all_settings.setting: Mute all participants when they join a meeting
all_settings.description: Automatically mute all participants when they join the meeting. The host controls whether participants can unmute themselves.
Receive desktop notification for upcoming meetings. Reminder time can be configured in the Zoom Desktop Client.

all_settings.setting: Don't allow agendas to be shared with external users
all_settings.description: By default, the meeting agenda is automatically shared with all invitees. When this setting is enabled, the agenda will be shared only with invitees in your organization.

all_settings.setting: Require media encryption for 3rd party endpoints (SIP/H.323)
all_settings.description: By default, Zoom requires encryption for all data transferred between the Zoom cloud, Zoom client, and Zoom Room. Turn on this setting to require media encryption for 3rd party endpoints (SIP/H.323) as well.
Allow meeting and webinar participants to send chat messages.

all_settings.setting: By default, allow participants to chat with
all_settings.description: Controls who participants can chat with by default during a meeting.

all_settings.setting: Allow users to copy or save chats from the meeting
all_settings.description: Controls who is allowed to copy or save chats from the meeting.
Chat will continue before, during, and after the meeting in Team Chat for signed in users.

all_settings.setting: Default enabled Continuous Meeting Chat for "Schedule meetings"
all_settings.description: A sub-setting to automatically enable continuous meeting chat for scheduled meetings.

all_settings.setting: Enable Continuous Meeting Chat for "Instant meetings"
all_settings.description: A sub-setting to enable continuous meeting chat for instant meetings.

all_settings.setting: Allow participants to delete messages in meeting chat
all_settings.description: When this setting is enabled, participants can delete their own messages and hosts (and co-hosts) can delete any messages sent during the meeting.

all_settings.setting: Allow participants to edit messages in meeting chat
all_settings.description: When this setting is enabled, participants can edit their own messages sent during the meeting.

all_settings.setting: Enable the Screenshot feature in meeting chat
all_settings.description: When this setting is enabled, participants can send screenshots during the meeting.

all_settings.setting: Allow participants to use emojis in meeting chat
all_settings.description: Allow participants to use the emoji library in meeting chat. Choose between allowing participants to use any emoji in the library, or choose to allow only pre-selected emojis.
Allow meeting participants to send direct messages to other participants and allow webinar panelists to send direct messages to other panelists.
Automatically save all in-meeting chats so that hosts do not need to manually save the text of the chat after the meeting starts.

all_settings.setting: Allow hyperlinks in Meeting and Webinar Chat
all_settings.description: Allow users to send and click on hyperlinks in Meeting and Webinar Chat.
Hosts and participants can send files through the in-meeting chat.
A sub-setting to restrict file sharing to only specified file types.
A sub-setting to set a maximum size for files sent via chat.

all_settings.setting: Sound notification when someone joins or leaves
all_settings.description: Plays a sound notification when a participant joins or leaves the meeting.

all_settings.setting: Announce number of participants for dial-in participants
all_settings.description: Announces the number of participants for users who have dialed in.

Allow meeting participants to communicate without interrupting by reacting with emojis (e.g. clap, heart, laugh). These emojis are found in the Reactions menu in the toolbar, and when selected, they display on the participant's video and in the participants list for 10 seconds. Participants can change their emoji skin tone in Settings.
Allow previously removed meeting participants and webinar panelists to rejoin

all_settings.setting: Show invitee list in the Participants panel
all_settings.description: Users invited to meetings on other platforms (e.g. Google, Outlook, or Exchange) will also be shown on this list

all_settings.setting: Allow users to change their name when joining a meeting
all_settings.description: By disabling this setting, users will always use their name on profile page to join a meeting
Allow meeting participants and webinar panelists to rename themselves.

all_settings.setting: Allow host or co-host to rename participants in the waiting room
all_settings.description: Participants will be notified of name change

all_settings.setting: Hide participant profile pictures in a meeting
all_settings.description: All participant profile pictures will be hidden and only the names of participants will be displayed on the video screen. Participants will not be able to update their profile pictures in the meeting.
Allow participants to set meeting timers that can be seen and heard by everyone.
Select a default meeting wallpaper to be used for all meetings in your organization.

all_settings.setting: Allow users to join external meetings, webinars and events through mesh in the local area network
all_settings.description: If the external account has allowed mesh for any participants to join, some devices might be available as Zoom Mesh parents to distribute audio and video data in the local area network. This will provide a better experience and save bandwidth.
Allow users to report meeting participants for inappropriate behavior to Zoom's Trust and Safety team for review. This setting can be found on the meeting information panel.
Allow host to split meeting participants into separate, smaller rooms

all_settings.setting: Assign participants to breakout rooms when scheduling
all_settings.description: A sub-setting of 'Breakout room - Meetings'.
A sub-setting of 'Breakout room - Meetings'.
A sub-setting of 'Breakout room - Meetings'.

all_settings.setting: Allow host to view activity statuses of participants in breakout rooms (e.g. share screen, reactions)
all_settings.description: A sub-setting of 'Breakout room - Meetings'.
A sub-setting of 'Breakout room - Meetings'.
Allow meeting host to provide 1:1 remote support to another participant
Allow host to type closed captions or assign a participant/3rd-party service to add closed captions
Allow users to enable automated captions in these languages in meetings and webinars.
A sub-setting of 'Automated captions' specifying which languages are enabled.
all_settings.state: Selected languages: Chinese (Simplified), Chinese (Traditional), Croatian, Czech, Danish

all_settings.setting: Allow only the following users to enable captions for the meeting or webinar
all_settings.description: A checkbox to restrict which users can enable captions for the meeting or webinar.
Allow users to process automated captions on their device in meetings. To use this feature, the device must meet minimum requirements.
Allow viewing of full transcript in the in-meeting side panel
Allow participants to save fully closed captions or transcripts
Allow host to assign participants as sign language interpreters who can interpret one language into sign language in real-time. Host can assign interpreters when scheduling or during the meeting.

all_settings.setting: Enable sign language interpretation view by default in scheduler
all_settings.description: A sub-setting to enable the sign language interpretation view by default when scheduling meetings.
Allow another user to take control of your camera during a meeting. Both users (the one requesting control and the one giving control) must have this option turned on.

Allow users to add others to their Camera Control Group. When a member of the group requests camera control, they will automatically take control of the user's camera. Group members can be added or removed in Team Chat or Contacts.
Customize your background to keep your environment private from others in a meeting. This can be used with or without a green screen.

all_settings.setting: Allow use of videos as virtual backgrounds
all_settings.description: A sub-setting to permit the use of videos as virtual backgrounds.
Allow hosts to curate case-specific scenes, such as a classroom or boardroom for their meetings or webinars.
A sub-setting related to custom backgrounds within Immersive View.
A mode that shows only hosts and co-hosts' videos and profile pictures during a meeting. Focus Mode can be found in the "More" menu in the in-meeting toolbar.

all_settings.setting: Identify guest participants in the meeting/webinar
all_settings.description: Participants who belong to your account can see that a guest (someone who does not belong to your account) is participating in the meeting/webinar. The Participants list indicates which attendees are guests. The guests themselves do not see that they are listed as guests.
Allow user to add others to an 'Auto Answer Group'. Calls from members of a user's 'Auto Answer Group' will be automatically answered for that user.

all_settings.setting: Only show default email when sending email invites
all_settings.description: Allow users to invite participants by email only by using the default email program selected on their computer

all_settings.setting: Use HTML format email for Outlook add-in and plug-in
all_settings.description: Use HTML formatting instead of plain text for meeting invitations scheduled with the Outlook plugin

all_settings.setting: Override Zoom Outlook add-in local setting
all_settings.description: When enabled, the settings you set below will override users' local add-in settings.

all_settings.setting: Show a "Join from your browser" link
all_settings.description: Allow participants to bypass the Zoom application download process,
Note that the meeting experience from the browser is limited
Note that the meeting experience from the mobile browser is more limited than the desktop browser

all_settings.setting: Show "Always join from browser" option when joining from join.zoom.us
all_settings.description: Allow account members to enable "Always join from browser" when they join meetings from join.zoom.us.

all_settings.setting: Show a custom disclaimer when starting or joining a meeting
all_settings.description: Create your own disclaimer that will be shown at the start of all meetings hosted by your account
Select this option in the scheduler to request permission to unmute meeting participants and webinar panelists. Permissions, once given, will apply in all meetings scheduled by the same person.
Allow another user to take control of your audio controls during a meeting. Both users (the one requesting control and the one giving control) must have this option turned on.

Allow users to add others to their Audio Control Group. When a member of the group requests audio control, they will automatically take control of the user's audio settings. Group members can be added or removed in Team Chat or Contacts.

Allows meeting participants to turn off all incoming video feeds on their screen (does not affect other participants' screens). To access this feature, click the view button at the top-right corner of your screen.

all_settings.setting: When attendees join meeting before host
all_settings.description: Notify host when participants join the meeting before them
Notify host and participants when the meeting is cancelled

You can assign users in your account to schedule meetings on your behalf. You can also schedule meetings on behalf of someone that has assigned you scheduling privilege. You and the assigned scheduler must be on a Paid plan within the same account.

You can assign users in your account to schedule meetings on your behalf. You can also schedule meetings on behalf of someone that has assigned you scheduling privilege. You and the assigned scheduler must be on a Paid plan within the same account.
Automatically call all accepted participants (those who replied with Yes, Maybe, or No reply) at the scheduled time, regardless of whether the host has joined the meeting.

all_settings.setting: Require that all meetings are secured with one security option
all_settings.description: Require that all meetings are secured with one of the following security options: a passcode, Waiting Room, or 'Only authenticated users can join meetings'. If no security option is enabled, Zoom will secure all meetings with Waiting Room.

When participants join a meeting, place them in a waiting room and require the host to admit them individually. Enabling the waiting room automatically disables the setting for allowing participants to join before host.
All instant, and scheduled meetings that users can join via client, or room systems will be passcode-protected. The Personal Meeting ID (PMI) meetings are not included.

all_settings.setting: Require a passcode for meetings which have already been scheduled
all_settings.description: A checkbox to enforce a passcode for meetings that have already been scheduled.
The passcode that will be applied to meetings that were already scheduled.
All Personal Meeting ID (PMI) meetings that users can join via client, or room systems will be passcode-protected.
The passcode for your Personal Meeting ID.

all_settings.setting: Require passcode for participants joining by phone
all_settings.description: A numeric passcode will be required for participants joining by phone if your meeting has a passcode. For meeting with an alphanumeric passcode, a numeric version will be generated.

all_settings.setting: Embed passcode in invite link for one-click join
all_settings.description: Meeting passcode will be encrypted and included in the invite link to allow participants to join with just one click without having to enter the passcode.

all_settings.setting: Allow Zoom Rooms to become the host if they join before meeting host and other participants
all_settings.description: When this option is enabled, Zoom Rooms configured to 'Make Zoom Rooms the host if it joins before meeting host and other participants' will be permitted to assume the host role if they join before the meeting host and other participants.

all_settings.setting: Only authenticated users can join meetings from Web client
all_settings.description: The participants need to authenticate prior to joining meetings from web client.

all_settings.setting: Approve or block entry for users from specific countries/regions
all_settings.description: Determine whether users from specific regions or countries can join meetings/webinars on your account by adding them to your Approved List or Blocked List. Blocking regions may limit CRC, Dial-in, Call Me, and Invite by Phone options for participants joining from those regions.

all_settings.setting: Allow only the following users to enable captions for the meeting or webinar
all_settings.description: A checkbox to restrict which users can enable captions.

all_settings.description: A checkbox to enable sign language interpretation view by default in the scheduler.

Allow users to add others to their Camera Control Group. When a member of the group requests camera control, they will automatically take control of the user's camera. Group members can be added or removed in Team Chat or Contacts.

all_settings.setting: Override Zoom Outlook add-in local setting

all_settings.setting: Show a "Join from your browser" link
all_settings.description: Allow participants to bypass the Zoom application download process, and join a meeting directly from their browser.
Allows participants to join a meeting directly from their desktop browser. This is a workaround for participants who are unable to download, install, or run applications.
Allows participants to join a meeting directly from their mobile browser. Note that the meeting experience from the mobile browser is more limited than the desktop browser.

all_settings.setting: Show "Always join from browser" option when joining from join.zoom.us
all_settings.description: Allow account members to enable "Always join from browser" when they join meetings from join.zoom.us.

Allow users to add others to their Audio Control Group. When a member of the group requests audio control, they will automatically take control of the user's audio settings. Group members can be added or removed in Team Chat or Contacts.

Allows meeting participants to turn off all incoming video feeds on their screen (does not affect other participants' screens). To access this feature, click the view button at the top-right corner of your screen.

If the admin locks this setting, users will not be able to change the encryption type for meetings (i.e. scheduled, instant, PMI).
Start meetings with host video on
Start meetings with participant video on. Participants can change this when joining or in the meeting.

Determine how participants can join the audio portion of the meeting. When joining audio, you can let them choose to use their computer microphone/speaker or use a telephone. You can also limit them to just one of those audio types. If you have 3rd party audio enabled, you can require that all participants follow the instructions you provide for using non-Zoom audio.

all_settings.setting: Allow participants to join before host
all_settings.description: Allow participants to join before the host arrives. If participants are not allowed to join before the host, or the host has another meeting running, participants will see a dialog that notifies them that the meeting has not started. This dialog can be customized through the Customize Waiting Room setting.

all_settings.setting: Participants can join [time] before start time
all_settings.description: A sub-setting to specify how early participants can join before the host.
A Personal Meeting ID (PMI) is a 9 to 11 digit number that is assigned to your account. You can visit Personal Meeting Room to change your personal meeting settings.

all_settings.setting: Use Personal Meeting ID (PMI) when scheduling a meeting
all_settings.description: You can visit Personal Meeting Room to change your Personal Meeting settings.

all_settings.setting: Use Personal Meeting ID (PMI) when starting an instant meeting
all_settings.description: Use Personal Meeting ID (PMI) when starting an instant meeting.

all_settings.setting: Mute all participants when they join a meeting
all_settings.description: Automatically mute all participants when they join the meeting. The host controls whether participants can unmute themselves.
Receive desktop notification for upcoming meetings. Reminder time can be configured in the Zoom Desktop Client.

all_settings.setting: Don't allow agendas to be shared with external users
all_settings.description: By default, the meeting agenda is automatically shared with all invitees. When this setting is enabled, the agenda will be shared only with invitees in your organization.

all_settings.setting: Require media encryption for 3rd party endpoints (SIP/H.323)
all_settings.description: By default, Zoom requires encryption for all data transferred between the Zoom cloud, Zoom client, and Zoom Room. Turn on this setting to require media encryption for 3rd party endpoints (SIP/H.323) as well. 3rd party (SIP/H.323) endpoints that cannot negotiate media encryption compatible with Zoom's standards will be blocked from joining meetings.
Allow meeting and webinar participants to send chat messages.

all_settings.setting: By default, allow participants to chat with
all_settings.description: Controls who participants can chat with by default in a meeting.

Allow meeting participants to communicate without interrupting by reacting with emojis (e.g. clap, heart, laugh). These emojis are found in the Reactions menu in the toolbar, and when selected, they display on the participant's video and in the participants list for 10 seconds. Participants can change their emoji skin tone in Settings.
Allow previously removed meeting participants and webinar panelists to rejoin

all_settings.setting: Show invitee list in the Participants panel
all_settings.description: Users invited to meetings on other platforms (e.g. Google, Outlook, or Exchange) will also be shown on this list

all_settings.setting: Allow users to change their name when joining a meeting
all_settings.description: By disabling this setting, users will always use their name on profile page to join a meeting
Allow meeting participants and webinar panelists to rename themselves.

all_settings.setting: Allow host or co-host to rename participants in the waiting room
all_settings.description: Participants will be notified of name change

all_settings.setting: Hide participant profile pictures in a meeting
all_settings.description: All participant profile pictures will be hidden and only the names of participants will be displayed on the video screen. Participants will not be able to update their profile pictures in the meeting.
Allow participants to set meeting timers that can be seen and heard by everyone.
Select a default meeting wallpaper to be used for all meetings in your organization.

all_settings.setting: Allow users to join external meetings, webinars and events through mesh in the local area network
all_settings.description: If the external account has allowed mesh for any participants to join, some devices might be available as Zoom Mesh parents to distribute audio and video data in the local area network. This will provide a better experience and save bandwidth.
Allow users to report meeting participants for inappropriate behavior to Zoom's Trust and Safety team for review. This setting can be found on the meeting information panel.
Allow host to split meeting participants into separate, smaller rooms

all_settings.setting: Assign participants to breakout rooms when scheduling
all_settings.description: A sub-setting of 'Breakout room - Meetings'.
A sub-setting of 'Breakout room - Meetings'.
A sub-setting of 'Breakout room - Meetings'.

all_settings.setting: Allow host to view activity statuses of participants in breakout rooms (e.g. share screen, reactions)
all_settings.description: A sub-setting of 'Breakout room - Meetings'.
A sub-setting of 'Breakout room - Meetings'.
Allow meeting host to provide 1:1 remote support to another participant
Allow host to type closed captions or assign a participant/3rd-party service to add closed captions
Allow users to enable automated captions in these languages in meetings and webinars.
Allow hosts and participants to record the meeting to a computer. The recording will include video and shared content matching the recorder's view options, and an audio-only file.

all_settings.setting: Internal meeting participants (can request host permission to record)
all_settings.description: Host can change the permissions for each participant during the meeting. This option allows internal meeting participants to request permission.

all_settings.setting: Auto approve their permission requests (for Internal meeting participants)
all_settings.description: Automatically approve permission requests from internal meeting participants.

all_settings.setting: External meeting participants (can request host permission to record)
all_settings.description: Host can change the permissions for each participant during the meeting. This option allows external meeting participants to request permission.

all_settings.setting: Auto approve their permission requests (for External meeting participants)
all_settings.description: Automatically approve permission requests from external meeting participants.

all_settings.setting: Meeting participants with specified domains (can request host permission to record)
all_settings.description: Host can change the permissions for each participant during the meeting. This option allows participants from specified domains to request permission. Participants matching this option will take the precedence regardless the above two options.
Record meetings automatically as they start
By default, all users will see a recording disclaimer and hear an audio notification when a recording starts. This setting determines for whom the voice prompt is played.

all_settings.setting: Ask host to confirm before starting a recording
all_settings.description: Requires the host to confirm before a recording starts.
By default, phone users will hear one audio notification indicating that a recording has started. This option enables multiple notifications.

all_settings.setting: Use full display names for meeting assets generated by AI Companion
all_settings.description: By enabling this setting, you can override the display name that AI Companion detects for you with the full display name set in your profile.
Create clips that uses your user's chosen avatar to read the script they enter.
Allow users to create custom avatars for clips that would read the script they enter.

Generate crash dumps with more information in the event of an application crash on Zoom Workplace for Windows. Those information can assist Zoom with troubleshooting issues. The dumps are not automatically shared or uploaded to Zoom.
Users can provide satisfaction scores and other preset feedback to Zoom.

all_settings.setting: Allow users to send text feedback
all_settings.description: A sub-setting of 'Feedback to Zoom' that allows users to send text feedback.

all_settings.setting: Show "Join from a room" feature on Zoom meetings in the Zoom client
all_settings.description: Users can easily start a meeting on a Zoom Room from their Zoom client

all_settings.setting: Allow automatic direct sharing and pairing to Zoom Rooms using ultrasonic proximity signal
all_settings.description: Enable users to share their screen, start a meeting, switch a meeting in progress, open a whiteboard or send a phone call from their laptop or mobile device to Zoom Rooms, without entering a meeting ID or sharing key.

all_settings.setting: Hide potentially sensitive information on mobile task switcher
all_settings.description: By enable this option, iOS will blur the screenshot in the task switcher when multiple apps are open, and Android will hide the screenshot in the system-level recent apps list.

all_settings.setting: Change my status to away when screen saver begins
all_settings.description: While a user's presence status is in a calendar event and the computer screen saver begins, their presence status on Zoom changes to away.

When enabled, your account will have the ability to track and manage billable hours for phone calls and meetings. Users can assign client codes and add billing notes during or after a call or a meeting, and download billable hours reports directly from Contacts.

all_settings.setting: Enable manual control to start and stop billable hours tracking for calls and meetings.
all_settings.description: A sub-setting of 'Track billable hours' to manually control tracking.

all_settings.setting: Enable automatic tracking of billable hours for calls and meetings.
all_settings.description: A sub-setting of 'Track billable hours' to automatically track.

all_settings.setting: Show educational onboarding assistant for new features
all_settings.description: By enabling this setting, users will periodically see pop ups showing them how to set up new features in the Zoom Workplace app.

Generate crash dumps with more information in the event of an application crash on Zoom Workplace for Windows. Those information can assist Zoom with troubleshooting issues. The dumps are not automatically shared or uploaded to Zoom.
Users can provide satisfaction scores and other preset feedback to Zoom.

all_settings.setting: Allow users to send text feedback
all_settings.description: A sub-setting of 'Feedback to Zoom' that allows users to send text feedback.

all_settings.setting: Show "Join from a room" feature on Zoom meetings in the Zoom client
all_settings.description: Users can easily start a meeting on a Zoom Room from their Zoom client

all_settings.setting: Allow automatic direct sharing and pairing to Zoom Rooms using ultrasonic proximity signal
all_settings.description: Enable users to share their screen, start a meeting, switch a meeting in progress, open a whiteboard or send a phone call from their laptop or mobile device to Zoom Rooms, without entering a meeting ID or sharing key.

all_settings.setting: Hide potentially sensitive information on mobile task switcher
all_settings.description: By enable this option, iOS will blur the screenshot in the task switcher when multiple apps are open, and Android will hide the screenshot in the system-level recent apps list.

all_settings.setting: Change my status to away when screen saver begins
all_settings.description: While a user's presence status is in a calendar event and the computer screen saver begins, their presence status on Zoom changes to away.

When enabled, your account will have the ability to track and manage billable hours for phone calls and meetings. Users can assign client codes and add billing notes during or after a call or a meeting, and download billable hours reports directly from Contacts.

all_settings.setting: Enable manual control to start and stop billable hours tracking for calls and meetings.
all_settings.description: A sub-setting of 'Track billable hours' to manually control tracking.

all_settings.setting: Enable automatic tracking of billable hours for calls and meetings.
all_settings.description: A sub-setting of 'Track billable hours' to automatically track.

all_settings.description: By enabling this setting, users will periodically see pop ups showing them how to set up new features in the Zoom Workplace app.

all_settings.description: By enabling this setting, you can override the display name that AI Companion detects for you with the full display name set in your profile.
